description.value:
Trigger A non-plant creature enters the garden

Effect The blooms open, spawning a single @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.Wemmuth] that acts on the hazard's initiative, and the hazard rolls for initiative.

stealth.details: @Check[type:perception|dc:42|traits:action:seek] (master) to notice massive buds beneath the other foliage before they open

details.description: Five large flowers in the weed-choked field unfurl, each dusting pollen onto vines that animate into @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.Wemmuth]{Wemmuths}.
details.disable: @Check[type:nature|dc:48|name:Calm a Flower|traits:environmental] (master) or @Check[type:performance|dc:48|name:Calm a Flower|traits:environmental] (legendary) to calm a flower, closing it
details.reset: Wemmuths collapse into ordinary vines and the trap resets if the area is left alone for 1 minute.
details.routine:
d If there are fewer wemmuths than open flowers, the flowers create more wemmuths (so there as many wemmuths as open flowers) as their first action.

For their second action, the flowers produce a mind-addling pollen. Each non-plant creature within 30 feet of a flower must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:41|name:Mindaddling Pollen|traits:emotion,mental,olfactory] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Slowed]{Slowed 1} for 1 round (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Confused] for 1 round, on a critical failure). The pollen is an emotion, mental, and olfactory effect.
